trans-unit.target: TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_SEQ_00<tab>Gerbert longs for the days when statues of Rhalgr dotted the Peaks.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_TODO_00<tab>Examine the statues at the designated locations.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_000<tab>Ah, good to see you again. Pleased to say those rats have not bothered me since you scared them off.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_001<tab>In fact, could I ask for your help once more?

TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_002<tab>The Peaks used to be filled with more Rhalgr statues than you could shake a stick at. Of course, the Empire did not approve of this and ordered them all to be destroyed.

TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_003<tab>Though as luck would have it, I have heard two survived. The only issue is the bridges that used to lead to them have fallen into disrepair. Hence why I have been unable to check them myself. Please search for them in my place.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_004<tab>I have marked both their locations on your map. Good luck!
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_005<tab>I have marked the locations of both Rhalgr statues on your map. Good luck!
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_SYSTEM_000_020<tab>The statue is missing two key components: an arm and its head.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_SYSTEM_000_030<tab>This statue has also seen better days.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_041<tab>Oh, that is truly a shame. I suppose it was foolish of me to get my hopes up.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_042<tab>The monks belonging to the Fist of Rhalgr and the religion's followers used to go on pilgrimages often to compare the different statues.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_043<tab>No matter how long it takes, I will make sure the statues are reconstructed. I will not stand back and watch as this tradition dies.
TEXT_STMBDZ918_02874_GERBERT_000_044<tab>My thanks for taking on such a difficult task. Here, take this as your payment.
